semmcci: Methods (MC)

Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan

2023-08-19

Source: vignettes/methods-mc.Rmd
methods-mc.Rmd
library(semmcci)
library(lavaan)

Data 

summary(df)
#>        X                   M                   Y           
#>  Min.   :-3.199558   Min.   :-3.371276   Min.   :-3.61432  
#>  1st Qu.:-0.636035   1st Qu.:-0.692640   1st Qu.:-0.66146  
#>  Median : 0.011377   Median : 0.007125   Median :-0.04726  
#>  Mean   :-0.003207   Mean   :-0.023968   Mean   :-0.01677  
#>  3rd Qu.: 0.651951   3rd Qu.: 0.647363   3rd Qu.: 0.62640  
#>  Max.   : 3.470910   Max.   : 2.963216   Max.   : 3.09950
colMeans(df)
#>            X            M            Y 
#> -0.003206987 -0.023968103 -0.016774294
var(df)
#>           X         M         Y
#> X 1.0600162 0.5108780 0.5069458
#> M 0.5108780 0.9996606 0.6272104
#> Y 0.5069458 0.6272104 0.9837255

Model Specification 

model <- "
  Y ~ cp * X + b * M
  M ~ a * X
  indirect := a * b
  direct := cp
  total := cp + (a * b)
"

Model Fitting 

fit <- sem(data = df, model = model)

Monte Carlo Confidence Intervals 

unstd <- MC(fit, R = 20000L, alpha = 0.05)

Methods

print 

print(unstd)
#> Monte Carlo Confidence Intervals
#>             est     se     R   2.5%  97.5%
#> cp       0.2333 0.0260 20000 0.1823 0.2842
#> b        0.5082 0.0270 20000 0.4549 0.5613
#> a        0.4820 0.0267 20000 0.4293 0.5343
#> Y~~Y     0.5462 0.0242 20000 0.4983 0.5939
#> M~~M     0.7527 0.0339 20000 0.6857 0.8186
#> X~~X     1.0590 0.0000 20000 1.0590 1.0590
#> indirect 0.2449 0.0187 20000 0.2089 0.2823
#> direct   0.2333 0.0260 20000 0.1823 0.2842
#> total    0.4782 0.0262 20000 0.4274 0.5292

confint 

confint(unstd, level = 0.95)
#>              2.5 %    97.5 %
#> cp       0.1823071 0.2842036
#> b        0.4549030 0.5612613
#> a        0.4292582 0.5342988

#> indirect 0.2088988 0.2823237
#> direct   0.1823071 0.2842036
#> total    0.4273726 0.5292175

Standardized Monte Carlo Confidence Intervals 

fit <- sem(data = df, model = model, fixed.x = FALSE)
unstd <- MC(fit, R = 20000L, alpha = 0.05)
std <- MCStd(unstd, alpha = 0.05)

Methods

print 

print(std)
#> Standardized Monte Carlo Confidence Intervals
#>             est     se     R   2.5%  97.5%
#> cp       0.2422 0.0266 20000 0.1897 0.2939
#> b        0.5123 0.0244 20000 0.4640 0.5599
#> a        0.4963 0.0239 20000 0.4476 0.5417
#> Y~~Y     0.5558 0.0234 20000 0.5097 0.6011
#> M~~M     0.7537 0.0237 20000 0.7066 0.7997
#> X~~X     1.0000 0.0000 20000 1.0000 1.0000
#> indirect 0.2542 0.0175 20000 0.2203 0.2885
#> direct   0.2422 0.0266 20000 0.1897 0.2939
#> total    0.4964 0.0239 20000 0.4478 0.5419

References
